required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: LISA vs INSURE in Extremely Low Birth Weight Infants. A Manikin Study
clinical_study.official_title: Does LISA Change the Time of Device Positioning Compared to INSURE in Extremely Low Birth Weight Infants With RDS? A Crossover Randomized Controlled Manikin Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This is an unblinded, randomized, controlled, crossover (AB/BA) trial of surfactant treatment with LISA vs. INSURE in a manikin simulating an extremely low birth weight infant. Participants will be level III NICU consultants and residents. Randomization will be performed using a computer-generated random assignment list. The primary outcome measure will be the total time of device positioning. The secondary outcomes will be the success of the first and the participant's satisfaction.

detailed_description.textblock:
Background: Although LISA offers some advantages in ventilation procedure and neonatal outcomes over INSURE, the use of a catheter during LISA may have some drawbacks such as the prolonged duration of the laryngoscopy needed to insert the device. This is likely to aggravate the invasiveness of the procedure, resulting in stressful consequences such as bradycardia, hypoxia and hemodynamic changes.
Objectives: i) time of device positioning, ii) success of the procedure of positioning the device, iii) participant's satisfaction.
Methods: This is an unblinded, randomized, controlled, crossover (AB/BA) trial of surfactant treatment with LISA vs. INSURE in a manikin simulating an extremely low birth weight infant. Participants will be level III NICU consultants and residents. Randomization will be performed using a computer-generated random assignment list. The primary outcome measure will be the total time of device positioning. The secondary outcomes will be the success of the first and the participant's satisfaction.

primary_outcome.description: Time needed for the correct positioning of the device (thin catheter or tracheal tube). In case of failure, total time will be the sum of time of all attempts.

secondary_outcome.measure: Success of the procedure at the first attempt
secondary_outcome.description: It refers at the success of the device positioning during the first attempt
At the end of the procedure, all participants will be required to fill a 5-item questionnaire aimed to assess their perception on the procedure (Likert scale)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Surfactant administration with less invasive surfactant administration (LISA) approach
arm_group.description: Participants will be randomized to administer surfactant in a preterm manikin by using the LISA approach (thin catheter)
Participants will be randomized to administer surfactant in a preterm manikin by using the INSURE approach (tracheal tube)

intervention.description: Participants will be randomized to administer surfactant in a preterm manikin by using the LISA approach (thin catheter) or the INSURE approach (tracheal tube)
intervention.arm_group_label: Surfactant administration with less invasive surfactant administration (LISA) approach

intervention.description: Participants will be randomized to administer surfactant in a preterm manikin by using the INSURE approach (tracheal tube)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Level III NICU consultants and residents will be eligible to participate in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- There are no exclusion criteria for this study.
